Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric is partly red and grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394523) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394523)
